body_html:
By looking at the tutorial: https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/tflearn/#tf-contrib-learn-quickstart, I was able to make the script work by adding feature_column in Line 106. The script that works is attached.
text_classification_with_model_saving.zip

One more question, is there any way to report individual probability for each class? I remember classifier.predict_proba() can be used in earlier versions like r0.8/0.9. I tried predict_proba(), but all I got is <generator object <genexpr> at 0x7f6dcfb4a410>
body_text:
By looking at the tutorial: https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/tflearn/#tf-contrib-learn-quickstart, I was able to make the script work by adding feature_column in Line 106. The script that works is attached.
text_classification_with_model_saving.zip
One more question, is there any way to report individual probability for each class? I remember classifier.predict_proba() can be used in earlier versions like r0.8/0.9. I tried predict_proba(), but all I got is <generator object <genexpr> at 0x7f6dcfb4a410>
body:
By looking at the tutorial: https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/tflearn/#tf-contrib-learn-quickstart, I was able to make the script work by adding feature_column in Line 106. The script that works is attached.
[text_classification_with_model_saving.zip](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/736259/text_classification_with_model_saving.zip)


One more question, is there any way to report individual probability for each class? I remember `classifier.predict_proba()` can be used in earlier versions like r0.8/0.9. I tried `predict_proba()`, but all I got is `<generator object <genexpr> at 0x7f6dcfb4a410>`
